title: The CDC's New Mask Guidance, Explained, And A Look At How Long Vaccines Protect Us
description:
Fully vaccinated people can ditch the mask outdoors, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention said this week — unless they're at a crowded event. Dr. Anthony Fauci explains the new guidance to NPR and weighs in on how soon children under 16 might be eligible for vaccines.

NPR's Joe Palca reports on the scientific effort to learn more about how long vaccines protect us.

Additional reporting in this episode from NPR's Allison Aubrey.

In participating regions, you'll also hear from local journalists about what's happening in your community.

Email us at considerthis@npr.org.

itunes:title: The CDC's New Mask Guidance, Explained, And A Look At How Long Vaccines Protect Us
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Fully vaccinated people can dine outdoors, gather with friends, and exercise outside without a mask, the CDC said on Tuesday.
itunes:subtitle: Fully vaccinated people can dine outdoors, gather with friends, and exercise outside without a mask, the CDC said on Tuesday.
